  • Works with internal Vanguard managers to define application changes, negotiate priorities and implementation dates, agree on service level standards, and 'partner' for success with regards to predefined remediation mandates.
  • Updates Risk tracking system with vulnerabilities risk rankings.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required.
  • Five years of experience performing vulnerability analysis, Information Assurance analysis, or Red Team penetration testing against operational computer networks including experience in Windows Security, Network Security, Linux/Unix Security, Database security, or Mainframe Security.
  • CEH and CISSP required
  • Must have technical knowledge to validate any finding that automated tools alert or find
  • Experience with Vulnerability Management tools like Qualys or Nessus.
  • Experience with Web Application Pen testing.
  • Experience architecting, writing and compiling simulated malware code to validate vulnerabilities and compromise complexity.
  • Experience with Data Loss Prevention solutions like Digital Guardian, McAfee or Symantec.
  • Demonstrates excellent communication skills, analytical ability, strong judgment, and the ability to work effectively with others.
  • Demonstrated ability to understand strategic objectives and vision, and work towards those goals.
  • Demonstrated ability to remain calm and professional while working in a high pressure incident situation.

Special Factors

  • This is an on-call position and may require working nights, weekends, and holidays.

From its start in 1975 as a bold new experiment, Vanguard has grown to become one of the world's largest and most trusted mutual fund firms. We take pride in having helped millions of clients to accomplish their financial objectives. The company, headquartered outside Philadelphia in Malvern, Pa., is also much admired for its strong culture and the impact that the Vanguard crew have on the communities where they live and work.

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst for Retail Marketing to use analytics to inform and educate Vanguard about clients and prospects through descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytic insights.

Duties and Responsibilities

1.  Executes analytic projects to provide insight into client needs and behavior, supporting marketing and client servicing decisions.

2.  Engages with project sponsors and stakeholders to understand each business question. Probes for hidden questions and goals. Helps bring structure to each request and translate requirements into an analytic approach.

3.  Acquires structured and unstructured data and prepares it for analysis. Investigates, extracts, cleans, transforms, QCs and manages data using SQL and Base SAS programming techniques. Identifies and diagnoses data inconsistencies and errors and forages to fill data gaps.

4.  Analyzes data to describe client behavior and preferences, understand channel usage, diagnose client experience problems, size marketing opportunity, target clients for treatment and measure the impact of marketing and servicing initiatives. Utilizes appropriate analytic methods and specialized tools to generate insights, answer the business questions and fulfill project objectives.

5.  Prepares and delivers insight presentations and action recommendations. Communicates complex material in layman's terms. Guides business partners on the interpretation and use of analytic results.

6.  Administers model score, experimental data and documentation libraries.

7.  Develops and applies domain knowledge of Vanguard’s businesses and data.

8.  Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.

　　

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in an analytically oriented major, such as statistics, mathematics, economics or an applied social science. Academic training in applied statistics preferred.
  • A minimum of three years general experience and three years of relevant professional experience in analytical roles.
  • Knowledge of financial services and marketing.
  • Able to take disparate data and understand it, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate it.
  • SAS and SQL programming skills. Understanding of data structures.
  • Logical problem solving skills.
  • Experience gathering requirements, developing analytic approaches, and applying quantitative methods to harvest insights.
  • Industry experience applying statistical techniques (modeling, regression methods, decision trees, forecasting, clustering, time series).
  • Excel and PowerPoint skills.
  • Able to communicate complex concepts and analysis to a variety of audience knowledge levels. Data visualization and storytelling skills.

　　

Special Factors
Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

wd:jobFamily.wd:Job_Family_Name: Data Reporting and Analysis Group - Planning 3

wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
To assist in the execution of the vision, strategic direction, and initiative roadmap for strategic, business technology projects. To help define the reference and implementation architectures for strategic, business technology projects. To persuade and influence Business and Information Technology (IT) leaders on the architectural direction for strategic, business technology projects.

This position is for an experienced data architect to support the expansion of Vanguard's businesses across different countries, legal, compliance and finance departments.

International and Corporate Systems is launching multiple multi-year strategic programs across International, Legal, Finance and HR business areas. These programs are in different stages from infancy to execution.

ICS Architecture team plays a key role as strategic partner for business and IT leaders in shaping the business and technology direction for these programs. As a member of ICS architecture team, you will get the opportunity to establish data strategy and architecture for Operational, Business Intelligence and CRM agendas.

  • This role will provide opportunity to lead following activities;
  • Hands on partnership with delivery teams for development of International Enterprise Database and Product Data Infrastructure to support global markets
  • Conducting POCs for implementation of new technology concepts within Big Data and Next Gen data Architecture space
  • Partnering with senior business and IT leaders to shape the agenda for business technology programs and for adaption of new architecture within the scope of business funded programs.
  • Global implementation of new CRM solution

Ideal candidate should have experience working with Oracle, SQL Server and Big Data Analytics platforms like Hadoop, etc. The qualified candidate should have excellent leadership and communication skills.

Duties and Responsibilities

1. Provides the architectural leadership in shaping strategic, business technology projects, with an emphasis on application architecture. Utilizes domain knowledge and application portfolio knowledge to play a key role in defining the future state of large, business technology programs.

2.  Utilizes a broad and deep understanding of the competitive landscape and corporate and business unit strategies to provide context for architectural decision making.

3.  Within area of responsibility, continuously pursues strong knowledge of business technology solutions and maintains understanding of applicable technologies, tools, and services:

  • Establishes working relationships with appropriate business technology solution providers (e.g., Salesforce, Charles River, Reuters, etc.).
  • Leverages knowledge capital available through subscription research services that target business technology solutions (e.g., Forrester on Digital Business, Cutter on investment management, etc.).
  • Leverages the Internet and trade periodicals that focus on the contemporary, competitive, business technology issues within the financial industry.
  • Attends financial industry conferences and engages in associated activities (e.g., conducting presentations, leading workshops, etc.).

4.  Defines reference and implementation application architectures.

5.  Produces technology roadmaps in support of SI’s application portfolio vision and strategy.

6.  Monitors application implementation activity to ensure architecture and design principles are upheld.

7.  Ensures application implementation solutions support the business objectives (asset gathering, cost optimization, client loyalty improvement), as appropriate.

8.  Participates in governance team discussions and provides a strong voice on critical decisions.

9.  Establishes relationships with senior IT and Business leaders for the purpose of advancing proposed application architecture solutions.

10.  Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

 

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.
  • Minimum five years relevant work experience.

Special Factors
Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

To provide senior level data modeling services, including building logical database models for new databases, and capturing complex business data requirements.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Provides senior level data modeling services, including updating and building logical database models for regularly scheduled releases, including those for new databases with large numbers of users and interfaces.  Evaluates completeness and accuracy of data models.
  • Uses a variety of information gathering techniques (e.g., interviews) to gather complex business data requirements from internal business clients and development teams.  Analyzes data requirements.  Provide conceptual and technical modeling assistance to developers.  Validates data models with IT team members and internal clients.
  • Reviews data models with lead to assess the impact of the new model on the enterprise model.  Identifies data sources and areas of overlap, and facilitates data sharing.
  • Participates in Inspections, data analysis, and data discovery sessions.  Attends operations engineering review (OER) meetings to address data modeling changes to reviewed databases and the enterprise database.
  • Works with senior DBA staff to transform logical database models into physical database designs.
  • Creates and writes documentation, including procedures.  Administers document repositories.
  • Collects and maintains meta data.
  • Trains and mentors staff with less experience.  Resolves complex issues elevated from staff with less experience.
  • Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels.  Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience
  • 2-5 years data modeling experience, including experience with business requirements analysis, entity relationship design, and data normalization experience
  • Strong written and oral communication skills, including interviewing and group facilitation skills
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills
  • Understanding of the financial services industry
  • Advanced knowledge of the following data modeling practices and concepts:
  • Meta data
  • Technical standards and deliverables
  • Relational database implementations
  • Business requirements analysis
  • Relational databases
  • Entity relationship design
  • Data normalization
  • Work flows
  • Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products:
  • DB/2
  • ERwin
  • Lotus Notes
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Sybase
  • Visio
  • Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products, preferred:
  • Microsoft Access
  • Microsoft Project

Special Factors

  • NoSQL experience is welcome
  • Remote and off hours support may be requested
  • Some on call hours may be requested

wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Posting: Director of Finance and Controller (Vanguard Charitable)
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Title: Director of Finance and Controller (Vanguard Charitable)
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
Vanguard Charitable was founded by Vanguard in 1997 as an independent 501(c)(3) organization focused on supporting donors' charitable plans. Although we are separate entities, Vanguard Charitable is strongly aligned with Vanguard's principled investment philosophy and unwavering values, including its commitment to diversification, transparency, and cost-effective service. We firmly believe in the importance of long-term, strategic charitable planning that minimizes costs and maximizes the impact of philanthropic giving.

Financial operations professional with extensive experience in corporate accounting and treasury management responsible for safeguarding Vanguard Charitable’s (VC) assets and oversight of all accounting, finance, financial reporting, budgeting, banking, large and unique brokerage trades, money management, payroll, compliance and regulatory filing for VC.  Responsibilities also include audits and investment reporting.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure that appropriate controls, checks and balances, and reconciliation procedures are in place and executed to safeguard VC’s assets
  • Supervise the Accounting and Finance Services team—including staffing, development, coaching, objective-setting, evaluations and training
  • Develop and maintain written procedures, policies, workflows and dashboards
  • Manage relationship with VG relating to fund accounting and investment trading departments
  • Manage related Gemini matters as well as change requests initiatives
  • Perform confidential activities including, but not limited to, payroll and funding of retirement programs
  • Responsible for the monthly financial package, all closing activities, schedules, and documentation
  • Maintain financial reports for management, Board of Trustees and external entities (auditors, tax reporting and state filings)
  • Coordinate and oversee the annual external audit and any regulatory audits
  • Coordinate and compile the annual budget preparation for management and Board of Trustees, including what-if analyses of growth opportunities
  • Coordinate state regulatory reporting
  • Coordinate and handle preparation, support and filing of Federal forms 990, 5500 and 1099
  • Maintain corporate insurance
  • Ensure adequate IRS/FASB regulatory compliance that meet industry standards
  • Maintain professional interface and relations with external business partners
  • Assist in conducting risk assessments for VC; review current financial processes and analyze for possible improvements, consistency and efficiencies of processes; work with VC team to effectuate process changes
  • Understand the roles and responsibilities as a staff member to Vanguard Charitable’s Business Contingency Program.  Positively influence and support the organization toward meeting contingency objectives.
  • Complete special projects as assigned

Requirements

  • Undergraduate degree in accounting or finance
  • Ten years accounting experience that includes accounting, financial, investment, treasury management, accounts payable, payroll, closing processes, financial statements, management reporting, budgeting, audit, tax, and regulatory compliance
  • Five years accounting manager experience
  • Non-profit experience preferred
  • Team player, excellent communicator and strong negotiator
  • Demonstrated willingness to both lead and do basic work

NOTE:  This role is for Vanguard Charitable.

Vanguard Charitable is a leading U.S. nonprofit organization that fulfills its mission to increase philanthropic giving by administering a donor-advised fund--a tax-effective way to consolidate, accrue, and grant assets to charity. Our philanthropic accounts offer donors a flexible and convenient way to give and, ultimately, help them make a greater charitable impact.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies seeks a Divisional Risk leader – Information Technology to lead risk management for the Information Technology division. The Divisional Risk Leader will provide senior leadership to the team in the implementation and execution of the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) framework and serve as a technical expert and a trusted adviser to business leaders throughout the Information Technology (IT) division.

  • Oversees all aspects of the divisional risk management department.  Effectively manages the team and creates an environment that is conducive to teamwork, innovation and objectivity, which motivates a highly competent, driven and productive team.
  • Oversees the efficiency and effectiveness within the team. Sets measurable goals and examines ways to raise standards, to increase quality and to improve overall performance of the team. Monitors team progress and measures team and departmental success in identifying and managing risk exposure for the division.
  • Applies analytical insight, judgment and experience to evaluate risk and interacts with and advises the IT executive business leadership team.  Serves as a technical expert and trusted advisor to senior management on risk-related decisions including those related to new products/services, significant initiatives, and ongoing operations.
  • Designs and implements risk management programs that interact with and influence a wide range of business areas without disrupting the business activity. Works effectively with external consultants and regulatory agencies in executing risk management and supporting compliance strategies. Serves clients in a consultative and supportive manner, ensuring that risks are well-managed, risk acceptance decisions are strongly supported and risk gaps are addressed.
  • Partners with IT senior leaders, and business partners to establish appropriate risk limits/appetite based on divisional risk profile along with enterprise and divisional policies.  Presents consolidated divisional executive reports and risk exposure metrics to senior IT business leaders.
  • Leads the risk governance program for the IT division, determining and ensuring adherence to risk management policies, firm standards, and industry best practices.  Participates on a firm-wide committee of senior risk management leaders chaired by the head of ERM to help support risk management across the organization.
  • Promotes relationship management and pro-actively fosters effective communication. Anticipates clients' needs and ensures client satisfaction related to the services being provided. Communicates clearly, comfortably and professionally to all levels of management and external stakeholders (e.g. regulators, auditors).  Ensures communications are timely, relevant and accurate.
  • Maintains an in-depth understanding of Vanguard and industry knowledge by keeping current on Vanguard, fund, industry, and regulatory events.  Takes an active role in industry forums.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Bachelor's degree is required with emphasis in IT, business, finance or accounting, related certification or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • A minimum of eight years general business experience with progressively responsible business functional operations management, compliance, risk management or auditing experience from which knowledge of internal control and risk management was obtained.
  • Demonstrated track record of success in a risk management and/or controls –related role within a significant global organizations in a regulated industry.  A background in financial services is a plus.
  • Broad familiarity with information technology, spanning infrastructure, applications and technology operations.
  • Proficient understanding of applications development as a service offering, change management, data and vendor management, information security and business continuity.
  • Excellent relationship management, communication, and analytical skills required.
  • Familiarity with risk management theory and experience in applying risk management concepts.
  • Executive level facilitation and presentation skills required.
  • Experience in situations requiring diplomacy and negotiating.
  • Ability to influence change initiatives amongst executive management.
  • The ability to complete a risk management certification.

Vanguard, one of the world’s largest investment management companies is seeking an Emerging Market Debt Portfolio Manager to join our Global Fixed Income Group. Vanguard is based on a simple but revolutionary idea-that a mutual fund company should be managed in the sole interest of its investors. To ensure that the interests of investors always come first, Vanguard is owned by the Vanguard funds, which in turn are owned by the investors. We're still the only company structured this way. Today, we state our mission broadly: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
Vanguard is looking for a portfolio manager to join our active emerging market and sovereign debt team. Vanguard employs a team approach in managing investments. The team is responsible for managing emerging market and government related positions across Vanguard’s multi-sector and dedicated products. The team’s philosophy revolves around a risk controlled approach with emphasis on active management, relative value, and country and security selection.

The Role:  Vanguard’s emerging market and sovereign debt team is a multi-disciplinary team that includes members from portfolio management, trading, strategy and research, economics, and risk and quantitative research.  The role would be reporting to the lead EM and Sovereign PM.  The PM would be part of the team and would be tasked with designing and implementing investment strategies across portfolios.  The PM would also be expected to contribute to the wider investment dialogue in Vanguard’s fixed income group.

The candidate:  A strong candidate would have 5-10 years investment experience, ideally in the investment management industry.  He or she would have a strong understanding of sovereign debt, including fundamental credit risk and relative value.  Understanding of portfolio construction and risk management is a must.   A candidate with trade execution experience would be preferred.  Experience investing via credit default swaps, interest rate swaps, and other derivatives is strongly preferred. In addition to expertise in sovereign debt, preference will be given for candidates with local market experience, including emerging market rates and FX.  Experience investing in EM corporates would be a plus.

The candidate must also possess:

  • Undergraduate degree required, graduate degree preferred or  professional designations such as a CFA
  • Excellent communications skills, be a team player, and share Vanguard’s dedication to our clients
  • Demonstrated ability to in applying portfolio management concepts to the actual portfolio process
  • Knowledge and experience in the use of Bloomberg and other security and portfolio analysis systems

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks an Enterprise Records Management Program Lead to lead Vanguard’s enterprise-wide Records Management Program that ensures compliance with domestic and international records and data retention requirements.

  • Defines the strategic approach for the Enterprise Records Management Program, which establishes policies, procedures, assessments, and remedial actions necessary for all Vanguard operations to comply with domestic and international record retention, data retention, and records management requirements, including, creating and overseeing a strategic Records Management department and framework within the Enterprise Data Governance and Privacy Department. 
  • Lead the team that designs, plans, and implements operational components of the Enterprise Records Management Program to address the retention and destruction of physical and electronic records and data.
  • Develops and implements the supporting strategic communications plan for the Enterprise Records Management Program to engage, educate, and influence leaders about records management issues, policies, procedures, and controls.  This includes the development, implementation, and delivery of senior staff communications concerning the effectiveness of the Enterprise Records Management Program.
  • Designs, develops and maintains enterprise-wide records management metrics to measure the effectiveness of the program, including appropriate benchmarks to legal, regulatory, and industry standards.
  • Independently sets strategy to prioritize and remediate records management risks by designing and influencing the adoption of appropriate controls across the enterprise. 
  • Develops and maintains effective relationships with other business leaders, including Enterprise Data Governance Councils and Practice Leads, Legal and Compliance, Information Security, Records Services, and IT leaders across the International and domestic divisions to influence the adoption and on-going engagement with the Enterprise Records Management Program.  Provides records management advice to the enterprise and senior executives. And leads the communications to the Enterprise Data Governance Council and Enterprise Risk Council concerning the program. 
  • Leads Vanguard’s external communications to Institutional clients and regulators about Vanguard’s records management practices.  Interacts with global regulators and legal requests as needed to respond to inquiries and demonstrate compliance.
  • Leading staff to success by fostering an inclusive environment and managing to their diverse needs.  Creating a culture of engagement by providing personalized coaching, training, and motivation.  Setting standards, reviewing performance, and providing feedback, all in order to develop staff. 
  • Leads special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience (JD, Master's or professional degree preferred).
  • Minimum 8 years' relevant work experience in records management, regulatory compliance, information systems, information technology, internal audit, risk & control, or information security, disciplines.  Hands on experience implementing corporate-wide records management programs.
  • Active participation in records management professional industry organizations and conferences (ARMA, MER, Sedona, AIIM, etc). 
  • Experiencing leading teams. Demonstrated ability to manage a diverse group of professionals and skilled at working through others along with experience in building and leading teams.
  • Broad understanding/familiarity with Vanguard's business and the investment industry.
  • Demonstrated ability to: quickly develop a command of new concepts, including domestic and international privacy laws and data security best practices; and complete multiple and diverse assignments with the highest level of accuracy and quality.
  • Excellent project and program management and prioritization skills.  Strong understanding and experience with process design, compliance, and risk management preferred.
  • Demonstrated ability to translate technical, regulatory, and legal requirements into a clear, understandable framework that is actionable by the business.
  • Demonstrated understanding of how to balance practical business realities with risk mitigation needs.
  • Superior organizational and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to collaborate successfully with all levels in the organization.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills to senior management.
  • The ability to work in an ad-hoc/dynamic and fast-paced environment with frequent time-sensitive deadlines.
  • Experience and ease in interfacing with Senior Staff and other officers across the organization.
  • Ability to travel to Vanguard domestic and international sites.

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

To manage the Equity and Options Trading Desk responsible for trades placed through Vanguard including options transactions, large equity and ETF trades, trades in foreign markets and other specialty transactions. In addition, the team is responsible for facilitating on-line order flow and performing other daily functions related to order management.

Duties and Responsibilities
1.  Manages exempt and nonexempt level staff.  Provides guidance, training and motivation as necessary to develop staff.  Evaluates and counsels personnel. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides feedback, and administers compensation in accordance with applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.
2.  Develops and implements policies and procedures that help to manage risk and meet regulatory requirements. Supervises the team to ensure that policies and procedures are being followed.
3.  Develops long and short term goals and objectives.  Develops and implements operational strategies around items such as administrative procedures, service levels and quality.  Analyzes costs impacting operational decisions and develops cost effective solutions to operational issues.
4.  Participates in the development of departmental budget.  Estimates costs for headcount, staffing issues, current volume, forecasts for anticipated volumes, and related operational expenses to implement annual objectives/performance improvements and ensures department operates within established budgetary guidelines. 
5.  Partners with internal clients to assist in meeting department objectives while contributing to a seamless service for shareholders.
6.  Generates a variety of standard and ad hoc reports and presentations for management.  Highlights operational trends, justifies expenses, spending, etc.  Proposes and presents operational innovations and procedural, policy, and process modifications to the management team for review and action.
Maintains knowledge and awareness of organization, industry and regulatory trends.
7.  Supports Vanguard Unmatchable Excellence (VUE) concepts.
8.  Facilitates special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • A minimum of 5 years progressively responsible operational experience with at least 2 years supervisory experience.
  • Strong knowledge of the brokerage/investment industry required.
  • Perspective, flexibility, and judgment to evaluate issues/problems of high complexity and make sound decisions.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong relationship management skills.
  • Series 7 and 63 license required.
  • Attainment of all required licenses (7, 63, 24, 4) within 90 days of start date.

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks an Operations Associate to support the Operations team and shared services for the Canadian business including but not limited to finance for both fund and corporate levels. The role liaises with the appropriate shared services functions and external service providers to ensure the integrity of financial reporting and performance standards.

Your primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Provision of meaningful fund and management reporting to enable effective oversight of the various functions reporting into the Head of Operations.  Assist in production, review and distribution of fund financial reports, tax reporting, investor communications, and some ad hoc management reporting requests.
  • Serves as primary contact for service providers; attending bi-weekly meetings to discuss internal and external issues logs.  Evaluates service metrics from monthly meetings.  Ensure services provided by service providers meet Vanguard's standards and highlight issues that affect standards where necessary.
  • Serves as primary contact for Fund Financial Services and Corporate Financial Services queries, working with internal and external stakeholders to identify and resolve issues.
  • Creates and maintains the Business Continuity Plan for Vanguard Canada.  Attend quarterly contingency coordinator meetings or as required.  Manages the maintenance of the Issues and Tracking logs.  Monitors log and highlights issues that occur regularly. Analyses issues and resolves where appropriate.
  • Serves as primary contact for accounts payable, invoicing queries, Procurement services and vendor maintenance.
  • Provides support to the Operations team on day to day responsibilities and complex requests.    Monitors completed work to ensure accuracy, maintaining the reputation of the Operations team internally and externally.
  • Backup support and secondary contact for institutional client servicing involving Transfer Agency functions.
  • Participation in Vanguard product and business initiatives as appropriate.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other related duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Undergraduate degree (in accounting or finance). CA or similar designation preferred or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum of three years of experience in the industry, with an emphasis to finance and operations.
  • Demonstrated ability to function in a high volume/fast paced environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities.
  • Comprehensive understanding of broad financial concepts including accounting, finance and economics.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills/presentation skills.
  • Excellent Computer skills including Microsoft Excel, Word, presentation software and three dimensional databases.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to think strategically.
  • Ability to develop and maintain relationships with internal and external clients.
  • Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with senior management as well as various levels of staff and management across the organization.
  • Ability to take on and successfully lead/participate in corporate citizenship initiatives.

Note: Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

From its start in 1975 as a bold new experiment, Vanguard has grown to become one of the world’s largest and most trusted mutual fund firms. We take pride in having helped millions of clients to accomplish their financial objectives. The company, headquartered outside Philadelphia in Malvern, Pa., is also much admired for its strong culture and the impact that the Vanguard crew have on the communities where they live and work.

The SENIOR COMPLIANCE ADMINISTRATOR for our Financial Advisory Services will develop, implement and maintain compliance and control programs for Financial Advisory Services; Provide technical expertise on compliance policies (Vanguard and departmental), procedures, and workflows; and Participate in the preparation of reports for management.

Responsibilities

  • Develops and implements compliance and control programs for Business Sales, consistent with applicable legal and regulatory guidelines, industry practice, and safe and sound business practices.
  • Maintains knowledge of compliance policies and procedures for Business Sales. Develops and maintains a thorough understanding of the written supervisory procedures (WSPs) and how they are being monitored. This includes understanding the rationale behind compliance policies and procedures.
  • Develops and implements policy and procedure practices and manuals. Coordinates with ERM, Legal and the Compliance Department in developing consistent policy, procedures, programs and solutions for business initiatives.
  • Provides oversight of compliance program testing activities. Researches, analyzes, and summarizes results for management reporting and review.
  • Leads/assists with projects related to compliance activities. Manages multiple priorities/projects from inception through implementation. Coordinates, prioritizes and actively manages tasks as needed to meet project timelines.
  • Applies Vanguard Unmatchable Excellence methodology to develop and present dashboards to monitor and enhance current processes and activities.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum of three years related compliance experience.
  • Currently holds Series 7, 63, and 24 licenses, or ability to obtain required licenses within 90 days.
  • Knowledge of security rules and regulations preferred
  • Knowledge of investment management business and financial services industry preferred.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access preferred.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including strong persuasive and negotiation skills.

Special Factors

  • This position may require minimal travel.

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

The Strategy and Finance division is home to Vanguard's experts in Corporate Financial Services, Fund Financial Services, Internal Audit and Corporate Strategy. Our crew are high caliber professionals who provide financial and decision support leadership to all businesses at Vanguard across the globe. Integrity is key – as stewards of fund assets and Vanguard’s assets, we must protect data, mitigate risk, stay competitive, and proactively establish business initiatives, all while returning value to clients. Strategy and Finance is a talent destination for exceptional financial minds looking to be part of a best-in-class organization that is one of Vanguard’s most trusted voices. Vanguard is seeking a Finance Director to provide financial support to Vanguard's most complex business areas. Financial support generally includes analytical evaluation and quantification of opportunities for decision support, administration and influence of the long-term and fiscal planning/reforecasting processes both within assigned client areas and corporately, accountability for division level accounting processes, controls and any regulatory requirements as applicable, procurement accountabilities in the areas of prioritization and process transparency, playing a leadership role in the area of supplier relationship management and other leadership responsibilities across the organization.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manage and develop staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides regular and ongoing feedback
  • Develops analytic methodologies for evaluating, quantifying and forecasting business unit assets, revenues, and expenses based on business drivers and employs scenario modeling methodologies to explain the impact of strategies or changes in the business environment.
  • Develops knowledge of our most complex business areas (as defined by size, scope, and opportunity for impact) and their strategies, and utilizes this knowledge to propose and develop analyses that increase the financial understanding of the business, business segment, client, product and/or relevant activity.
  • Develops and/or provides guidance to developers of financial models that assist business units in both tactical and strategic planning.
  • Is influential across departmental lines and structures
  • Attends appropriate client pricing meetings, develops client pricing models and makes recommendations regarding client pricing.
  • Manages and validates the work of others.
  • Develops and/or ensures the development of business case analyses for key investment initiatives.
  • Disseminates timely and accurate financial information to allow for efficient use and effective control over financial resources of a business unit, project, service etc.
  • Leads and administers an effective supplier management process for the business.
  • Ensures division level accounting and applicable regulatory functions are managed with excellence.
  • Participates and/or leads in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. MBA and/or Professional Certification preferred.
  • Minimum of eight years’ experience in broad financial management functions (accounting, finance, regulatory, procurement, risk/control, etc.).
  • Demonstrated ability to function in a high volume/fast paced environment working with multiple and diverse responsibilities.
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence across departmental lines.
  • Comprehensive understanding of broad financial concepts including accounting, finance, procurement, risk and economics as appropriate.
  • Experience in situations requiring diplomacy and negotiation.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills/presentation skills.
  • Excellent technical skills including Microsoft Excel, Word and presentation software.
  • Ability to anticipate future consequences and trends accurately.
  • Knowledgeable in current and future policies, trends and information affecting Vanguard's business.
  • Track record of strong people leadership.

Note:

  • Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Financial Advisor to develop and maintain an ongoing partnership with a range of clients through regular, meaningful contact as part of the Personal Advisor Services offer. As a Financial Advisor, you will be working closely with clients to develop a customized goals-based financial plan based on their unique financial situation-then manage their portfolio to help reach their financial goals.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Develop a thorough understanding of each client's financial situation in order to create and deliver a suitable strategy based upon Vanguard's investment philosophy.  Provide investment strategies to achieve client goals.  Identify the appropriate risk tolerance, discuss appropriate savings or spending strategies and provide additional financial planning solutions as needed.  Partner with Senior Advisors on more complex accounts.   Provide both verbal and written plans to communicate the recommended strategies following department guidelines.
  • Manage client portfolios on an ongoing basis and continue to build and retain your assigned client base.  Serve as clients investing coach, conducting periodic review of portfolios and providing appropriate reports addressing clients' ongoing advisory needs.
  • Provide one-time advice to clients as appropriate for the client situation.
  • Demonstrate a mastery of Client Relationship Management (CRM) skills along with written and verbal communication skills to build and strengthen client relationships.
  • Initiate and implement the agreed upon investment strategy; comply with Vanguard methodology and investment guideline; document and maintain organized client files which meet department compliance standards.
  • Address each client's ongoing advisory and wealth management opportunities and provide semi-annual formal reviews of each client's financial situation. Provide ad-hoc client support as needed through verbal and written communication.
  • Promote professional development by maintaining an in-depth understanding of financial planning, capital markets and the financial services industry.  Stay abreast of significant changes or developments (e.g. taxation, regulatory, legal, competitive, technical) within the fields of investments and financial services.
  • Maintain all required licenses and designations.
  • Maintain an in-depth understanding of compliance, regulatory and departmental policies and procedures. This includes obtaining a thorough knowledge of the regulatory requirements for Vanguard's anti-money laundering policies and procedures.   Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Certified Financial Planner designation required.
  • FINRA Series 7, 65 and 63 licenses (or ability to obtain within 120 days of assuming position).
  • Minimum of three years related financial planning and client relationship management experience.
  • Exceptional client relationship management skills - both internal and external client facing.
  • Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
  • Positive attitude with the ability to effectively manage change and adapt in a continual and rapidly changing environment.
  • Ability to work independently and as a team member, balances multiple responsibilities simultaneously, and demonstrates exceptional time-management skills.

Note: Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position. Additionally, employment is contingent on a successful drug-screening result.

Vanguard, one of the world’s largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Financial Advisor Associate to build ongoing relationships and provide portfolio management to a diverse array of clients and communicate our investment philosophy and recommendations in a clear and concise manner while working within a collaborative team environment.

  • Develops a thorough understanding of each client's financial situation in order to create and deliver a suitable strategy based upon Vanguard's investment philosophy. Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Financial Advisor Manager to hire, develop, engage, and coach a team of Financial Advisors to provide one time advice and financial plans, as well as manage a book of business. You will advance business objectives for Retail Advice including cost to serve, loyalty, and retention.

Your Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manages advisor staff. Provides guidance, coaching, and motivation as necessary to develop staff. Hires, evaluates and counsels personnel. Follows corporate disciplinary procedures per established Vanguard standards as required. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides feedback and recommends wage increases in accordance with the applicable HR policies and procedures.
  • Regularly provides feedback and coaching to Advisors. Develops, implements, and monitors goals and action plans for Advisors. Reviews Advisor performance and identifies trends, suggests improvements, and provides analysis/feedback to Advisor.
  • Demonstrates and advocates change leadership for team in rapidly evolving business. Responsible for managing and developing a book of business with Advisors. Coaches advisors to develop strategies to deepen client relationships with the advisor and with Vanguard as evidenced by retention, net new assets, and referrals. Works with team to develop and implement comprehensive financial planning strategies, allowing clients to meet their goals.
  • Works collaboratively with members of the Retail Advice management and project teams along with other business segments. Develops and recommends changes to policies and procedures to meet changing business needs. Works closely with other members of management to develop and implement staffing and operational plans.
  • Provides technical support to team and business in areas of financial planning. Supports Financial Advisors in analyzing and resolving client planning issues and developing solutions.
  • Participates in audit and control processes by auditing based on department standards, monitoring controls, and providing ongoing feedback.
  • Develops close working relationships with all appropriate stakeholders both within and outside of department to meet Vanguard business requirements.
  • Participates in development of business planning. Analyzes departmental statistics and prepares management reports. Uses available data to monitor problems and measure success of the team and the business. Identifies opportunities and executes solutions, both strategically and tactically.
  • Builds and maintains understanding of financial planning, capital markets, and the financial services industry. Responds quickly to industry and internal developments.
  • Assesses what should be communicated to the department, and does so in a timely, accurate and effective manner. Determines the most appropriate method of communication, given the nature of the content.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience, advanced degree preferred.
  • Minimum of five years progressively responsible and related experience (including supervision of others).
  • Knowledge or experience in the financial planning industry preferred.
  • Book of business experience or experience leading others who manage a book of business preferred.
  • Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designation preferred.
  • Series 7, 66, & 24 licenses or ability to obtain within 120 days.
  • Extensive knowledge of Vanguard investment offerings and Vanguard methodology
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong leadership and personnel development skills.

To provide tax planning, research, and compliance services to Vanguard's investment entities and their investors.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Review US tax returns for regulated investment companies (1120-RIC, 8613, etc.)
  • Review and/or prepare year-end tax provision and related financial statement tax disclosure for regulated investment companies, including uncertain tax positions memorandums under ASC 740. Assists with response to external auditors for financial reporting
  • Review global tax withholding filings and international income tax returns
  • Review US tax treatment of corporate actions such as mergers, acquisitions, spin offs. Advise other internal departments to ensure optimal tax accounting and reporting
  • Review all book-tax difference computations, including §1092 straddle adjustments, PFICs, derivatives, §382/CLCF
  • Review, advise other internal departments, and answer shareholder questions regarding shareholder tax reporting
  • Keeps abreast of legislative and regulatory tax developments in the mutual fund industry domestically and internationally.  Identifies, evaluates and implements mandated changes and tax planning opportunities
  • Responds to various requests for tax analysis of investments and shareholder impacts
  • Identifies and implements ways to improve tax efficiency
  • Establishes and maintains excellent working relationships with internal groups
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting or Finance, or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum three years general experience.
  • Previous knowledge of mutual fund industry preferred.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office.
  • Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment companies, with more than $3 trillion in global assets, is seeking a leader who will be responsible for the development, execution and administration of Vanguard's global mobility strategy and programs in alignment with the company's culture and overarching total rewards and talent philosophy.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manage and develop staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides regular and ongoing feedback
  • Lead design of global strategy for international relocation, tax and immigration, including program and policy design, execution and assessment; develop creative solutions to meet immediate and long term business objectives which ultimately results in a highly satisfied expat population.
  • Manage global mobility policies and program guidelines to ensure industry competitiveness and compliance with legal, tax, and local employment regulations. Stays current with industry trends and best practices.
  • Provide strategic global mobility-related expertise, consultation, and cost estimates to local and home office key stakeholders to ensure alignment with business and HR/Talent strategy, tax, and legal / compliance. Includes working with the business on identification of roles and assignees.
  • Act as main point of contact and talent-enabler for international assignees to maintain a strong, on-going relationship and expat experience.
  • Manages and coordinates the third-party vendor relationships in support of the tax equalization and international relocation process. Develops, implements, and leads a vendor management program to ensure a strong and productive partnership exists between all vendors and Vanguard and includes key performance indicators to measure effectiveness.
  • Lead team in development of marketing materials and communication plans that are in alignment with regional regulations and local cultural needs in order to promote global mobility as a key part of the company’s talent strategy.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • An undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Advanced degree is preferred.
  • Minimum eight years of HR experience.     
  • Experience managing global relocation and immigration programs with a strong focus on vendor management for a multi-national company.
  • Knowledge and experience working with tax, legal, compensation, benefits, and immigration issues (specifically in the area of Visa / Work Permit filings).
  • Knowledge of HR policies and processes.     
  • Experience in the development and implementation of initiatives from strategy through execution. 
  • Experience working with senior leadership and the ability to operate and influence in matrix and flexible environment.
  • Strong customer service orientation and vendor management skills.  
  • Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills.   
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to organize and present information in a clear and concise way to a variety of audiences.
  • Demonstrated commitment to developing staff skills and building capabilities

Note:

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard’s story is one of the most extraordinary ones in the mutual fund business. From its start in 1975 as a bold new experiment, Vanguard has grown to become one of the world’s largest and most trusted fund firms. We take pride in having helped millions of clients to accomplish their financial objectives. The company, headquartered outside Philadelphia in Malvern, Pa., is also much admired for its strong culture and the impact that the Vanguard crew have on the communities where they live and work. Within this setting, Vanguard is seeking an experience Global Security Specialist to assist with the planning and execution of the Shelter In Place Plan.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Assists in the implementation of the Shelter-in-Place (SIP) Plan on a global basis, to include Pre-drill meetings, SIP Drills, and Post Drill meetings.
  • Schedules and manages multiple tasks concurrently, related to the execution of the SIP Plan.
  • Handles project management and leadership displayed through development and maintenance of Action Items, Dashboards, SIP documents to include Word and Powerpoints.
  • Develops and maintains liaison with Building Evacuation Officers, Contingency Coordinators, and Building Evacuation Team members in support of the SIP Strategy.
  • Conducts various meetings with personnel and management in furtherance of the SIP Program across all business lines.
  • Attends and conducts SIP drills, Pre-drill meetings, and Post SIP Drill meetings to discuss status of the event and offer guidance and recommendations relative to improvement and ongoing training for attendees/participants.
  • Conducts building inspections, to include reviewing security systems, and addressing any actions and making recommendations for improvement.
  • Prepares various reports related to the SIP Program, to include Weekly Status Reports, Dashboards, Action Spreadsheets, etc., with appropriate follow up.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum three years general experience. Security experience preferred.
  • Strong PC knowledge preferred.
  • Strong analytical skills preferred, with report writing experience.
  • Strong organizational, oral/written communication, and liaison skills.

Additional Information

  • Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

To provide senior-level expertise, customization, and user support for third-party vendor technology products.

Duties and Responsibilities

1.  Translates senior-level user-defined capabilities into system/product requirements. Works with more experienced technology specialists to understand business rationale and client expectations.

2.  Assesses the feasibility of requirement implementation and makes informed recommendations to management. Suggests mutually agreeable alternatives, when applicable.

3.  Implements agreed upon solutions to documented business needs. Customizes (recodes) standard third-party vendor products to comply with business needs.

4.  Evaluates success of product modification and regularly monitors performance to ensure ongoing utility. Resolves complex issues as they arise.

5.  Integrates third-party products into the Vanguard environment, frequently with the collaboration of Systems Integration teams. Evaluates vendor products with respect to technical requirements to fill business capability needs, product maturity, and integration complexity.

6.  Provides subject matter expertise in assigned projects through all phases of the development lifecycle. Defines field of use, standards, and best practices around assigned products and technologies.

7.  Supports assigned products by responding independently to client inquiries and resolving issues of greater complexity. Provides technical guidance and mentoring to less senior crew.

8.  Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Minimum five years experience in application design, architecture and development. Understanding of software engineering processes and system development life cycles.
  • Expert systems experience with Hadoop (e.g.  HDFS, Hive, Impala, Oozie, YARN, Sqoop, Zookeeper, Flume, Spark, Kafka etc.).
  • Experience with Cloudera Manager and administrating an installation
  • Expert level experience with Linux, Java, shell scripting, and SQL
  • Strong problem solving skills and capability to understand and set direction for complex technology integration.
  • Good interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong teamwork skills and capability to lead teams.
  • Knowledge of the financial services industry a plus.
  • Knowledge of python, ksh, bash a plus.

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Posting: Head of Marketing, Latin America and Caribbean
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Title: Head of Marketing, Latin America and Caribbean
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
To develop and implement marketing plans and programs in a multi-channel, multi-country region for Vanguard funds and services in Latin America and the Caribbean. Build and manage a team to implement and support these programs.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manages staff. Provides guidance, training and motivation as necessary to develop staff. Hires, evaluates and counsels personnel. Follows corporate disciplinary procedures per established Vanguard standards as required. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides feedback, recommends wage increases in accordance with all applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.
  • Develop annual marketing strategy and budget that supports Latin America & Caribbean business and sales plans. Monitor and modify marketing strategy and tactics as needed.
  • Responsible for all activity, output, and results across the marketing mix, including collateral, website content and functionality, advertising, PR, events, client communications, sales support, market research, etc. Determine the positioning and packaging of Vanguard's offerings by crafting compelling arguments to ensure that clients and prospects understand the benefits of Vanguard's products, services, and global capabilities.  Create and monitor measurements to evaluate the performance and effectiveness of marketing programs.  Ensure that programs are fiscally responsible and are completed within budget.  Determine optimal mix of insourcing and outsourcing work. Manage external vendor and agency relationships.
  • Identifies sales and product opportunities, supports Latin America & Caribbean Sales and Relationship Management in the prospecting process and in developing leads, and develops the means to deepen relationships with existing clients.  Contribute at Latin America & Caribbean leadership team meetings and participate in defining Vanguard’s Latin America & Caribbean strategy.  Oversee gathering of competitive information and activities and make recommendations.
  • Partners with various Vanguard departments in the development and implementation of marketing programs and communication tools, including Latin America & Caribbean sales, client services and operations, International Marketing, Portfolio Review, Investment Strategy, Corporate Planning, Legal and other colleagues in International.  Coordinates governance activities with senior leadership and ensures integration, as needed, across marketing managers.
  • Manages marketing collateral for Latin America & Caribbean as it relates to risk, compliance and legal requirements.
  • Establishes and understands global messaging and style guidelines and monitors planning and implementation for activities related to Latin America & Caribbean sales, marketing, client service, and trade meetings and events with these guidelines top-of-mind for the audience.
  • Develops and execute the Latin America & Caribbean web and digital media strategy, working closely with internal Vanguard business partners to ensure implementation success.
  • Ensures that Latin America & Caribbean RFPs and presentations are completed accurately and on time, including following consistent global processes and enterprise systems.  Ensures the marketing team delivers on the logistics for events, including event registration, site selection, meeting room setup, food and beverage functions, contracting and negotiating with hotels and suppliers, and holding pre-and post-event meetings with internal clients and external vendors.
  • Keeps abreast of industry trends and developments and regulatory issues through the review of industry publications and market research, by participating in industry and professional associations, attending industry conferences, and through contact with industry experts. Maintain an in-depth knowledge of client needs and trends.
  • Manages and/or participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.  Graduate degree in Marketing preferred.
  • Minimum of 8 years business experience with at least 8 years in marketing or marketing related experience.
  • Working knowledge in the following areas; familiarity in one area must be balanced by technical expertise in others:  experience with financial marketplace; experience of marketing through intermediaries and/or institutional; client relationship experience (plan sponsor and/or participant) in sales, marketing, or client services; knowledge of investments, mutual funds, Vanguard funds, and investment marketing.
  • Demonstrated project management skills with the ability to manage others.
  • Demonstrated client focus on client needs and client communications.
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Special Factors:  Ideal candidate is fluent in English and Spanish.

The Strategy and Finance division is home to Vanguard's experts in Corporate Financial Services, Fund Financial Services, Internal Audit and Corporate Strategy. Our crew are high caliber professionals who provide financial and decision support leadership to all businesses at Vanguard across the globe. Integrity is key – as stewards of fund assets and Vanguard’s assets, we must protect data, mitigate risk, stay competitive, and proactively establish business initiatives, all while returning value to clients. Strategy and Finance is a talent destination for exceptional financial minds looking to be part of a best-in-class organization that is one of Vanguard’s most trusted voices. Vanguard is currently recruiting for a Head of Strategic Sourcing to provide leadership and oversight over category management, supplier negotiations, and strategic spend for Vanguard Group, Inc., and its subsidiaries.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manage and develop staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides regular and ongoing feedback.
  • Guides and influences Managing Directors, senior divisional leaders, and business partners on supply and demand strategies across all categories, soliciting trust and authority based on deep expertise in all Vanguard-relevant suppliers and categories.
  • Acts as a thought leader, developing long-term category strategies that drive significant value on Vanguard’s $1.8 billion of third-party spend.
  • Acts as a financial steward and strongly align with long-term enterprise-wide financial goal.
  • Collaborates with Head of Sourcing Operations for annual pipeline planning and resource allocation.
  • Ensures objectivity of sourcing process and serves as an escalation point for conflicts regarding sourcing objectivity.
  • Oversees and maintains accountability for the development of the Strategic Sourcing business plan and budget, as well as coaching direct reports (Category Managers) in developing a Profit and Loss (P&L) mindset.
  • Develops and implements operational plans to achieve departmental and corporate objectives.
  • Responsible for providing input for triaging engagements.
  • Makes staffing decisions and utilizes succession planning to accelerate crew development.
  • Maintains an in-depth understanding of Vanguard and industry knowledge by keeping current on Vanguard, fund, industry, and regulatory events.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • 10-15+ years’ experience in category management
  • Master's degree or equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Experience overseeing and participating in a large-scale organizational transformation
  • Experience managing a Profit and Loss (P&L) or equivalent
  • Strategic agility, particularly in fast paced, ambiguous environment working with a large crew of multiple skillsets
  • Ability to act as a high-level influencer by bringing thought leadership to stakeholders (both internal and external to Vanguard)
  • Excellent leadership, interpersonal, and motivation skills
  • Demonstrated commitment to developing staff skills and building capabilities

Note:

  • Individual will represent Vanguard in supplier negotiations alongside business leaders. Maintains expertise in all 5 relevant categories: IT, Banking and Investment-Related Services, Professional Services, Crew-Related [HR], and Office G&A.
  • Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Posting: Head of Third Party Risk Management
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Title: Head of Third Party Risk Management
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
The Strategy and Finance division is home to Vanguard's experts in Corporate Financial Services, Fund Financial Services, Internal Audit and Corporate Strategy. Our crew are high caliber professionals who provide financial and decision support leadership to all businesses at Vanguard across the globe. Integrity is key – as stewards of fund assets and Vanguard’s assets, we must protect data, mitigate risk, stay competitive, and proactively establish business initiatives, all while returning value to clients. Vanguard is currently recruiting for a Head of Third Party Risk Management to ensure efficient and comprehensive management of supplier risk, while monitoring adherence to broader enterprise and regulatory risk frameworks.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manage and develop staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides regular and ongoing feedback
  • Serves as Vanguard’s internal expert on third party supplier risk, guiding and influencing senior leaders across the enterprise on risk concerns. Serves as thought leader to develop and implement Third Party Risk Management (TPRM)-wide risk strategy consistent with changing enterprise-specific and industry-wide risk and regulatory environment.
  • Oversees all aspects of supplier risk management, ensuring objective supplier risk assessment and independent supplier risk reporting.
  • Maintains expertise in changing global regulatory requirements for supplier spend.
  • Leads the Enterprise Supply Management (ESM) risk governance program, determining and ensuring adherence to risk policies, firm standards, and industry best practices. Ensures appropriate mechanisms and processes for flagging, escalating, managing and resolving supplier risk issues. Establishes supporting processes, tools, templates required to support risk assessment.
  • Partners with managing director, senior divisional leaders, and business partners in ESM and wider risk organization to ensure suppliers’ compliance with established risk policies.
  • Serves as main risk partner to Strategic Sourcing and Sourcing Operations during initial supplier screening and onboarding processes.
  • Manages Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) organization and ESM-wide approach to risk, leading a team of senior risk experts including international risk specialists. Reviews TPRM achievement of key performance indicators to assess effectiveness of organization.
  • Acts as partner to ESM organization by leading key stakeholders to develop holistic strategy on supplier risk management and supplier performance management guidelines. Leads development of annual plans.
  • Makes staffing decisions and utilizes succession planning to accelerate crews' development and provide appropriate degree of staffing contingency.
  • Maintains an in-depth understanding of Vanguard and industry knowledge by keeping current on Vanguard, fund, industry, and regulatory events.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • 10+ years relevant experience in risk management and experience working with third party risk specifically
  • MBA preferred.  Master's degree or equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Deep knowledge of internal control and risk management with demonstrated understanding of the regulatory landscape and understanding of asset management
  • Strong controls mindset
  • Ability to build credibility and influence key internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong experience in data analytics & knowledge of supply base market analysis
  • Demonstrated commitment to developing staff skills and building capabilities

Note:

  • Understands and drives decision-making based on changing global regulatory requirements. Maintains an independent oversight arm within ESM.
  • Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

The Investment Risk Analyst will provide investment risk management expertise and analysis to the Vanguard Investment Management Group in a global environment.

Department Overview:
Vanguard’s Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent unit that makes risk management an integrated part of our investment process, dually focusing on comprehensive investment risk issues for Vanguard’s Fixed Income and Equity Investment Groups, as well as ensuring a best-in-class operational control environment. This team provides transparency, oversight, and governance of exposure across Vanguard’s investment groups.
RMG covers virtually all areas of risk management, including investment risk, portfolio analysis, quantitative research, and operational and counterparty risk. They also partner with Vanguard’s Global Investment Shared Services team to manage risk for systems and data management. Among their responsibilities, RMG produces reports on adherence to prospectus limitations and internal guidelines. The RMG team is comprised of approximately 50 risk managers, quantitative researchers, financial analysts, and data experts. The head of the Risk Management Group reports directly to Vanguard’s Chief Investment Officer, and is a member of the senior team that sets investment strategy for Vanguard.

Your primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Partners with Vanguard's Investment Management Group to define and develop an effective and efficient risk-reporting infrastructure in a global environment by gathering and analyzing data from various fund management units, writing reports, and providing recommendations and exercising judgment.
  • Uses a variety of analytical resources, under the direction of senior management, to develop new and enhance existing risk-return analysis, including risk monitoring, performance attribution, multi-factor risk models, benchmarking and scenario analysis. Analytical resources include but are not limited to FactSet, Axioma, CRD, Visual Basic, Excel, MATLAB, and other portfolio management systems.
  • Develops a deep understanding of Vanguard's investment management functional areas. Keeps abreast of current issues in business operations and incorporates changing business needs into risk analysis. Develops and maintains knowledge of financial markets, securities and general investment themes in order to bring an informed perspective to the risk management processes.
  • Keeps abreast of current financial markets, securities and investment themes in order to bring an informed perspective to the risk management processes.  Ability to think critically about broad range of potential investment risks, gathers relevant data and information systematically, can translate complexities and perceives relationships amongst data and trends.
  • Develops and executes complex business projects and directs colleagues on such projects. Meets established project milestones, goals and objectives within established time frames by utilizing a disciplined approach to delivering on time. Leads team with the identification, evaluation, and resolution of potential obstacles which may have an impact on the completion of the project.
  •  Presents thorough, clear, and insightful analysis to senior leaders, portfolio managers, and traders in a professional manner.
  • Undertakes a variety of ad hoc analytical projects as needed to support Risk Management Group (RMG).
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Bachelor’s degree with MS/MBA, CFA designation, or FRM strongly preferred
  • Minimum five years related analytical work experience.
  • Strong understanding of broad financial markets, including industry structure, trading practices, risk management techniques, and systems capabilities. Ability to handle multiple, complex projects with attention to detail while meeting deadlines.
  • Demonstrated quantitative and analytical skills, including statistical and regression analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, ambiguous working environment with multiple and diverse responsibilities.
  • Desire and aptitude to problem solve using system solutions such as advanced functions in Excel and Access; experience with VBA, SQL, and MATLAB strongly preferred.
  • Detail oriented with a high level of energy.
  • Proven self-starter with ability to work independently and within teams.
  • Effective influencing, collaboration, relationship management, project management and partnering skills

Notes:

This position may require you to disclose the political contributions you have previously precleared to ensure completeness and accuracy. Certain political contributions may disqualify you from consideration for this position.
