wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
Primary duties and responsibilities:

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Senior IT Auditor to perform complex projects to help Vanguard identify and manage risk to its business and investors.  Within the organization, the IT Audit Services (ITAS) team is seen as a critical line of defense for the organization.  ITAS is comprised of hard-working, highly motivated, and technically skilled professionals who consistently deliver high-quality work in a dynamic environment.  The team also promotes a flexible and well-balanced work environment. Senior IT auditors play a supporting role in all project phases. Individuals in this role demonstrate professional curiosity, have a continuous improvement mindset, possess the desire/aptitude to rapidly learn new skills and exemplify the highest degree of trust and integrity.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Execute projects and audits within the domains of: Security Policy, Security Governance, Access and Authentication Management, Threat and Vulnerability Management, Security Threat Intelligence, Security Response Management, and Application Security Architecture.
  • Stay abreast of current and emerging security risks that could impact the Company.
  • Research new technologies, understand existing processes, and reference recognized standards and frameworks.
  • Interface with our project clients to identify and understand potential risk areas.
  • Contribute to the definition of final project scope.
  • Analyze documentation, process information, technical configurations, or other client provided information and document the results of conversations and analysis.
  • Clearly articulate the status and results of work performed, both orally and in written form, to internal management and the project client.
  • Develop staff auditors in audit methodology, the understanding IT process and controls, and direct some staff activities.
  • Operate effectively and with minimal supervision, within a team or independently, performing special projects and related duties, as assigned.
  • Pursue continuous professional development through company paid internal/external training, certifications and/or continuing education.
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement.
  • Actively participate in Vanguard’s community service activities

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, Information Security, or a related discipline with solid academic credentials.
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience, with 3+ years of recent experience as a security practitioner.
  • Strong IT Security knowledge (application security architecture, network security, IT infrastructure, data security administration, database security). Working experience and/or knowledge of web and mobile technology.
  • Familiarity with common security risk frameworks, for instance, ISO 27000, NIST, and CIS Critical Security Controls.
  • Strong conceptual thinking aptitude.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including: written and verbal communications, willingness to assist in areas outside of direct assignments when necessary, and commitment to self-improvement and completion of team objectives.
  • Professional certification (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CompTIA, SANS, ISC2, etc.) is a plus.
  • Exposure to consulting, internal audit, compliance or other internal control functions is a plus.

Special Factors:

  • Ability to travel up to 10% annually, including domestic and limited international travel. Typical travel in this role is 0 to 5% annually.

Note: Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position. Additionally, employment is contingent on a successful drug-screening result.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice seeks a Senior Multi Asset Product Manager for their Product Management team. Vanguard is based on a simple but revolutionary idea-that a mutual fund company should be managed in the sole interest of its investors. To ensure that the interests of investors always come first, Vanguard is owned by the Vanguard funds, which in turn are owned by the investors. We're still the only company structured this way. Today, we state our mission broadly: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

The Product Management team serves as the hub of specialized product expertise for clients across the institutional, financial advisor and retail markets served by Vanguard. This interdisciplinary team of investment professionals is responsible for engaging with clients, consultants and advisors; assessing and managing the health of Vanguard’s product line-up; and ensuring the firm’s investment offerings are appropriately positioned in the market place. The Product Management group also recommends potential improvements to Vanguard products based on research, analysis and direct client insights. Finally, members of the Product Management team collaborate extensively with portfolio managers, investment strategists, marketing professionals and leaders across Vanguard’s major lines of business to support the success of new and existing investment products.

The Senior Multi Asset Product Manager will be responsible for representing Vanguard’s target-date, target-risk and other multi-asset class strategies in front of a wide range of institutional and advisory clients. This position will work closely with Vanguard’s Investment Strategy Group, Investment Management Group and other thought leaders to effectively represent the firm’s multi-asset investment philosophy to some of the largest and most sophisticated institutions and retirement plans in the country. Further, the Senior Product Manager will critically assess how these products are performing in the marketplace, and how Vanguard’s multi-asset products are positioned relative to similar offerings. This individual will use the information and insights they gain through these activities to champion recommendations that aim to improve the overall investment experience for Vanguard’s clients

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Serves as a key ambassador of Vanguard’s investment philosophy and how it is uniquely applied in constructing the firm’s multi-asset products, with a particular emphasis on the Vanguard Target Retirement Funds. Provides robust counsel to large retirement plans and their advisors, reflecting a deep understanding for not only Vanguard’s investment products, but the role they play within the broader, dynamic retirement savings ecosystem. Is able to take advanced concepts in capital markets, portfolio construction and investor psychology and effectively communicate them in an effective manner across a wide range of client types.
  • Attends and presents at industry conferences and client specific events related to the funds in your product category.  Publishes thought leadership commentary in support of the Vanguard product lineup.  Oversees the creation of dynamic content and technical marketing used to position Vanguard investment products and to respond to investor queries.  Contributes to new product launches in partnership with Product Strategy teams, and develops go-to Market strategies with the business marketing teams
  • Leads analyses of investment product issues confronting Vanguard’s Multi Asset product line-up (e.g. new products, product improvements, mergers/liquidations).  Leverages and manages cross-functional teams as required. Prepares and presents strategic analysis and recommendations to senior management at various forums.
  • Provides investment support and guidance to relationship management and sales teams on the product category; participates in meetings with financial advisors, plan sponsors, intermediaries, and UHNW investors.
  • Supports business line investment product research agendas to enhance client experience and business results.  Contributes to business specific asset management committees to share information about your suite of products and to help the businesses prioritize initiatives related to those products.  Also works with our corporate financial teams to inform product pricing.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate economics or finance degree; MBA and/or CFA preferred.
  • Minimum ten years of industry experience; with a demonstrated track record of engaging with senior investment decision makers within the investment management, investment consulting or asset owner communities.
  • Advanced knowledge of the investment management and retirement planning landscape, along with an in-depth understanding of the principles of asset management and investment markets.
  • Excellent relationship management, collaboration and influence skills.
  • Proven experience communicating complicated investment topics to sophisticated clients
  • Demonstrated record of initiative and career advancement and the ability to work independently at a high level.
  • Superior interpersonal, writing, and presentation skills.  Ability to build trust and work effectively with senior management and internal and external partners at all levels.
  • Willingness to travel
  • Series 7 and 63 licenses or ability to obtain within 6 months.

Special Factors

Travel required.

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies seeks a Senior Network Architect, Technical Advisor to provide strategic direction and expert level technical leadership for critical and complex initiatives in our Global Technology Operations organization. This includes participation in IT-wide governance to effectively communicate architecture goals and strategies and build consensus among senior technical leaders as well as communicate strategic technology direction to senior leaders across business unit organizations.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.  Degree in computer science or computer engineering, preferred. Minimum eight years experience in specific technical specialty (Hardware, Operating Systems, Software Development, Telecommunications and Emerging Technologies) See additional information in TCOYC for the specific requirements for this posting.  Broad IT experience preferred. Exceptional conceptual, analysis, and problem solving skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentation and influencing/negotiation skills. Broad knowledge of the financial services industry preferred. Expert conceptual knowledge leveraging architecture practices and implementation concepts.  General knowledge of one or more of the following:  Networks, Operating Systems, Data Models and applications. Provides expert level IT architecture analysis and design for enterprise-wide infrastructure across multiple applications, systems and platforms.  Specializes in:  technical, operations, development, or applications architecture.
  • Conducts architecture reviews to assess impact of proposed systems and prepares mitigation plans.  Recommends IT project team viable architecture choices.  Partners with IT managers and teams to understand business division needs, and advise and influence on implementation choices.  Assures project teams’ compliance with architecture standards and key controls, especially Production acceptance standards.
  • Creates, maintains, and enhances the multi-year architecture plans.  Ensure plans remain in alignment with Business and IT Strategic objectives and integrates with other architecture plans. Provides cross-team technical leadership across multiple project teams and organizations to maintain an ongoing productive relationship
  • .Leads  IT project teams in creating architecture documentation, including technical reviews and related infrastructure documents, architecture planning estimates, performance test plans, and IT architecture deliverables. Contributes to and is compliant with best practices such as, remaining consistent with the deliverable responsibilities outlined in our Software Development Methodology. Reviews and approves architecture-related documents developed by peers and project technical leadership.
  • Conceptualizes, analyzes and designs prototypes/systems that are consistent, compatible, reusable, scalable, available, reliable, maintainable, have optimal manageability and security, and perform well logically and physically.   Provide hands on help to projects in all aspects of Software Development Life Cycle
  • Stays current with industry trends and educates project stakeholders on relevant industry standards. Evaluates and tests 3rd party and open source products, and recommends buy/build.  Interfaces with architecture best practices trade organizations and research firms.
  • Identifies, analyzes and resolves the most complex issues elevated from IT project teams (production or non-production).  Recommends alternatives that improve system performance and/or optimize productivity and costs.
  • Identifies and mitigates risks of introducing architecture technology enhancements.      
  • Ensures that IT project teams comply with IT Governance policies and procedures. Verifies deliverables meet Information Security and Vanguard Systems Architecture requirements.  Develops and maintains technical standards.
  • Coaches other technical members of the team to develop their technical skills and competencies. Identifies the need for and helps prepare developmental programs and technical training.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.  Degree in computer science or computer engineering, preferred.
  • Minimum eight years experience in specific technical specialty (Hardware, Operating Systems, Software Development, Telecommunications and Emerging Technologies) See additional information in TCOYC for the specific requirements for this posting.  Broad IT experience preferred.
  • Exceptional conceptual, analysis, and problem solving skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentation and influencing/negotiation skills.
  • Broad knowledge of the financial services industry preferred.
  • Expert conceptual knowledge leveraging architecture practices and implementation concepts, such as:
    • feasibility
    • availability
    • standards compliance
    • deployability
    • extensibility
    • flexibility
    • interoperability
    • portability
    • predictability
    • recoverability
    • reliability
    • reusability
    • scalability
    • serviceability
    • testability
    • auditability
  • General knowledge of one or more of the following:  Networks, Operating Systems, Data Models and applications.

The Senior Product Manager will provide product expertise to crew and clients and to collaborate with business and investment teams to ensure the health and commercial success of the products. Communicate to investors in sales situations and via marketing collateral on our product offer, influence product strategy, collaborate with business and investment teams to ensure the health of our product offer, lead crew product education efforts, and contribute to strategic business priorities related to our products.

Your primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Provides investment support and guidance to relationship management and sales teams; is regularly called upon to participate in meetings with clients. (Financial advisor, plan sponsor, intermediary, and UHNW investors.)
  • Develops and maintains key internal stakeholder relationships across the organization including, business leadership, sales teams, capital markets, investment teams, marketing, and legal.
  • Leverages the client and sales feedback on our products in order to assess the product health, and drive ongoing product improvements and positioning.
  • Leads analyses of investment product issues confronting Vanguard’s product line-up (e.g. new products, product improvements, mergers/liquidations
  • Has the opportunity to attend and present at industry conferences and client specific events related to the product category of focus.
  • Contribute to thought leadership in support of the Vanguard product lineup.
  • Oversees the creation of dynamic content used to position Vanguard ETFs and to respond to investor queries.
  • Contributes to new product launches in partnership with Product Strategy teams, and develops go-to Market strategies with the business marketing teams
  • Facilitates internal ETF training and/or communications including training on launches and changes to existing products. Ensure coordination and consistency of product-related marketing initiatives and external communications across divisions
  • Supports business line ETF research agendas to enhance client experience and business results.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience required.  MBA and/or CFA preferred
  • Minimum 8 years of industry experience; investment experience preferred
  • Strong familiarity with Vanguard’s investment product line-up and an in-depth understanding of the principles of asset management and investment markets
  • Demonstrated ability to learn concepts quickly and complete multiple and diverse assignments with the highest level of quality and accuracy.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (fluency in Spanish and French a plus). Must be capable of being a contributor to enhancing Vanguard's image as an investment "thought leader" in writing and presentations
  • Exceptional collaboration skills; Ability to work well with and influence other groups such as sales, legal, and marketing.
  • Willingness to travel up to 20%.

wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Posting: Senior Quantitative Research Analyst - Global Active Rates
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Title: Senior Quantitative Research Analyst - Global Active Rates
wd:Report_Entry.wd:Job_Description:
Vanguard, one of the world’s largest investment management companies is seeking a Senior Quantitative Research Analyst to join the Risk Management & Strategy Analysis (RMSA) group supporting the global active rates fixed income team.

In this role, you will conduct research that improves the Investment Management Group’s (IMG) understanding of risk and return relationships through rigorous analysis and quantitative methods. Specifically, this role drives collaboration with the global active rates team to look at the markets in a systematic, strategic and quantitative way, identifying investment themes, developing trading strategy framework and models, proposing portfolio positioning strategies and sector outlook, and analyzing the risk of strategies and portfolios. The research is driven by robust and rigorous quantitative approaches.

In addition you will provide thought leadership and take a leadership role in shaping the research agenda and infrastructure in the RMSA group.  You will also Influence investment decisions through origination, development, and communication of powerful conceptual ideas, actionable strategies and recommendations that enhance the risk and return relationship balance in the portfolio.

You will also develop and maintain strategic partnership relationships with portfolio management teams and the RMSA team, as well as serve as an expert resource across IMG by supporting a variety of ad hoc analytical requests and project requirements for the IMG senior leadership team.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Minimum graduate degree with a concentration in a related field such as Financial Engineering, Statistics, Operations Research or Quantitative Research / Methods.  A Ph.D. is strongly preferred, coupled with professional designations such as a CFA or FRM
  • Deep experience (5 years plus) in developing quantitative strategies in the US rates and derivatives market required with some exposure to global markets
  • Eight to ten years of related analytical work experience.Rigorous training and work experience in econometrics modeling, stochastic modeling, asset pricing, risk modeling, advanced fixed income modeling (term structure and volatility), and risk premium modeling
  • Proficiency in Matlab or R, database programming (SQL), Bloomberg, Excel VBA
  • Demonstrated track record of originating investment ideas through quantitative methods and strong persuasion and influence skills to drive the quantitative research results through investment decision process across the IMG
  • Ability to produce thorough, insightful and concise analysis and communicate these findings to a variety of audiences in both group and one on one settings

The Strategy and Finance division is home to Vanguard's experts in Corporate Financial Services, Fund Financial Services, Internal Audit and Corporate Strategy. Our crew are high caliber professionals who provide financial and decision support leadership to all businesses at Vanguard across the globe. Integrity is key – as stewards of fund assets and Vanguard’s assets, we must protect data, mitigate risk, stay competitive, and proactively establish business initiatives, all while returning value to clients. Vanguard is currently recruiting for a Senior Strategic Transactions & Sourcing Lead to provide expert level sourcing and negotiation leadership for highly complex, strategic transactions for the benefit of Vanguard and its shareholders.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Leads sourcing and negotiation efforts through contract execution for the most complex, time intensive strategic transactions, with outcomes that minimize risk and maximize shareholder value. Typical transactions will be multi-million dollar, multi-year deals and/or involve Vanguard's most confidential and sensitive information.
  • Leads and effectively partners with cross-functional internal team and serves as primary Vanguard representative to external parties.
  • Develops and implements robust sourcing and negotiation strategies to ensure that "best value" is achieved.
  • Provides thought leadership and works with senior management in the planning, development and implementation of short and long range goals. Establishes highly effective, collaborative strategies to foster impactful partnerships with senior leaders and internal business clients.
  • Develops supplier, product and industry knowledge. Effectively leverages knowledge to develop and implement high impact sourcing and negotiation strategies that align with business and corporate needs and objectives.
  • Establishes professional relationships with strategic external parties and collaborates with internal clients and stakeholders to help position external relationships for success.
  • Drafts decision support documentation and transition support documentation.
  • Partners with colleagues and stakeholders to ensure that business risks related to supplier relationships are appropriately identified and managed.  Adheres to Vanguard's procurement policies, processes, and procedures to minimize potential financial or contractual risk.
  • Supports leadership team to develop and implement operational plans to achieve team, department and corporate objectives. Uses data to set goals, monitor progress, and measure success.
  • Demonstrates judgment, creativity and technical expertise, breadth of vision and initiative, commitment and accomplishment, communication skills, and leadership in a manner expected of role models and leaders of the Strategy & Finance Division.
  • Maintains memberships in appropriate professional organizations and engages in other industry forums to stay informed of leading and best practices to help advance the business. Develops and maintains knowledge of leading and best business practices. Maintains a high level of expertise in applicable areas of Vanguard's business lines and the mutual fund industry by keeping current on industry and regulatory developments affecting our business, and fostering an interest in Vanguard's initiatives and new services and products offered.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Graduate degree or an equivalent combination of training and experience; MBA or JD preferred.
  • Minimum of eight years related work experience required.
  • Exceptional client relationship, communication and negotiation skills.
  • Exceptional conceptual thinking, analytical and project management skills.
  • Excellent leadership, organizational savvy and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong track record of delivering exceptional business results.
  • Deadline oriented with demonstrated ability to deliver high quality results under pressure and manage competing priorities.
  • Demonstrated ability to learn highly complex and technical concepts quickly.

Note:

  • Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

To provide senior level IT technical lead services, including the direction, evaluation, selection, configuration, implementation, and integration of new or existing technologies and tools.

Are you interested in working with a variety of web development technologies and web applications? Are you motivated by owning your applications end to end? If so, this could be the Tech Lead role you’ve been looking for. The IT Systems Integration team owns multiple web applications that are written in various languages and databases. Our applications use : AngularJS, REST services, the latest node/grunt build process, Java, JavaScript, Adobe Flex, Oracle, and SQL Server.


You will have an opportunity to lead a team of talented full-stack developers who use all of these technologies to build robust solutions for our IT clients.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities

This staff member completes the following activities under moderate direction:

1.  Provides senior level IT technical lead services and direction (which may include) software, middleware, and/or hardware projects (e.g., applications, networks, communications, and client server technologies) on a single platform. Provides technical expertise in systems, technical infrastructure, tools, modeling, external interfaces, and other areas. Completes complex development, design, implementation, architecture design specification, and maintenance activities.

2.  Ensures the viability of IT deliverables. Recommends development options, including design, build/buy, and vendor purchase. Conducts testing, including functionality, technical limitations, and security.

3.  Identifies potential solutions, including the cost/benefit of each option. May approve solutions proposed by team members. Resolves complex issues uncovered by testers and internal clients.

4.  Communicates with project manager on a frequent basis. Identifies tasks and issues that may have an impact on service levels or schedules. Provides realistic task and cost estimates. May screen resumes, interviews, make hiring and assignment recommendations, and write reviews.

5.  Maintains current knowledge of IT development methodology, architecture design, and technical standards. Mentors IT staff with less experience and identifies training needs.

6.  Communicates with technical leads, IT groups, and clients so they understand the project's technical implications, dependencies, and potential conflicts. Evaluates the impacts of change requests on own/shared technologies.

7.  Reviews and approves documentation and diagrams created by IT team members, (e.g., system specifications). Writes documentation, including technical standards and processes.

8.  Identifies opportunities for continuous quality improvement of technical standards, methodologies, and technologies.

9.  May participate in design, code, and test Inspections throughout product life cycle to contribute technical expertise and to identify issues. Presents technical status and issues at milestone reviews.

10.  For teams without a BSA, performs this staff member's duties, including interviewing business liaisons to write the functional requirements. In the absence of the project manager, performs this staff member's duties, including coordinating daily systems analysis and development activities.

11.  Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures. Verifies team's deliverables meet Information Security requirements.

12.  Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

1.  Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience

2.  Five years experience in technical specialty. For development technical leads, includes two years' developer experience.

3.  Strong analysis and problem solving skills

4.  Knowledge of the financial services industry

5.  Advanced knowledge of the following technical lead practices and concepts:

  • Full product life cycle
  • Performance and stress testing
  • Security
  • Quality assurance methodology and Inspections
  • Technical standards and deliverables
  • Migration and integration
  • Estimating, including design, development/purchase, and installation
  • For development only: Production acceptance (including elevations), data modeling, data sharing, reusable components, and related advanced development standards

6.  Advanced knowledge of one or more IT platforms:

  • AS/400
  • Client/server
  • IBM mainframe
  • Microsoft Windows NT
  • OS/390
  • UNIX
  • See additional information for the specific requirements for this posting

7.  Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products:

  • Lotus Notes
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Visio
  • See additional information for the specific requirements for this posting

8.  For development only: Advanced knowledge of one or more development tools and programming languages:

To provide advice to clients utilizing both one-time and ongoing portfolio management solutions. To clearly communicate Vanguard's investment philosophy and recommendations to assist clients to reach their financial goals. To work well within a collaborative team environment partnering with internal representatives to serve client needs and providing coaching/mentoring for crew development.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Develop a thorough understanding of each client's financial situation in order to create and deliver a suitable strategy based upon Vanguard's investment philosophy. Consult with clients who have more complex financial planning needs due to high net worth. Provide investment strategies to achieve client goals. Identify the appropriate risk tolerance, discuss appropriate savings or spending strategies and provide additional financial planning solutions as needed. Provide both verbal and written plans to communicate the recommended strategies following department guidelines.
  • Manage client portfolios on an ongoing basis and continue to build and retain your assigned client base.  Serve as clients investing coach, conducting periodic review of portfolios and providing appropriate reports addressing client's ongoing advisory needs. Partner with the assigned internal business partner to determine client strategy for deepening client relationships.
  • Provide one-time advice to clients as appropriate for the client situation.
  • Demonstrate a mastery of Client Relationship Management (CRM) skills along with strong written and verbal communication skills to build and strengthen client relationships.
  • Participate in the business development process as needed with prospective clients to deepen relationships and determine appropriate advice solution.
  • Initiate and implement the agreed upon investment strategy; comply with Vanguard methodology and investment guidelines; document and maintain organized client files which meet department compliance standards.
  • Utilize department tools and technology to provide the optimal client experience.
  • Coach and mentor other crew to develop and strengthen skills for identifying cues and assessing clients need for advice.  Provide ongoing coaching and leadership to other crew.
  • Promote professional development by maintaining an in-depth understanding of financial planning, capital markets and the financial services industry. Keep abreast of significant changes or developments (e.g. taxation, regulatory, legal, and competitive) within the financial services field. Maintain all required licenses and designations.
  • Maintain an in-depth understanding of compliance, regulatory and departmental policies and procedures. This includes a thorough knowledge of the regulatory requirements for Vanguard's anti-money laundering policies and procedures.
  • Continuously identify process improvement opportunities along with business solutions.
  • Participate in special projects and perform other duties as assigned.

The Ideal Candidate Should Possess

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Certified Financial Planner designation required
  • FINRA Series 7, 65 and 63 licenses (or ability to obtain within 120 days of assuming position)
  • Minimum of five years related financial planning and client relationship management experience
  • High net worth client experience preferred.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach and develop internal business partners
  • Exceptional client relationship management skills - both internal and external client facing
  • Excellent writing and verbal communication skills
  • Positive attitude with the ability to effectively change and adapt in a continual and rapidly changing environment
  • Ability to work independently and as a team member, balance multiple responsibilities simultaneously, and demonstrate exceptional time-management skills

The Strategy and Finance division is home to Vanguard's experts in Corporate Financial Services, Fund Financial Services, Internal Audit and Corporate Strategy. Our crew are high caliber professionals who provide financial and decision support leadership to all businesses at Vanguard across the globe. Integrity is key – as stewards of fund assets and Vanguard’s assets, we must protect data, mitigate risk, stay competitive, and proactively establish business initiatives, all while returning value to clients. Strategy and Finance is a talent destination for exceptional financial minds looking to be part of a best-in-class organization that is one of Vanguard’s most trusted voices. Vanguard is seeking a Senior Workstream Lead to manage a complex, large-scale workstream or multiple workstreams within a multi-year transformational program that seeks to transform the operating model and organization design, process improvement, and the implementation of enabling technology to promote scalability and align with Vanguard’s goals and objectives.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manage and develop staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance and provides regular and ongoing feedback.
  • Creates and maintains a multi-year plan for assigned workstreams/project that clearly identifies specific actions and tasks needed to achieve future state goals. Provides written and oral communication to many different organizations and audiences within Vanguard on the status of the workstream/projects.
  • Manages a single large, complex workstream or multiple workstreams within global, multi-disciplinary transformational program.
  • Works with business clients, division/department leadership, and Information Technology to determine the scope, requirements and future state design for assigned workstream/project and ensures integration with other workstreams/project teams. Works effectively with identified stakeholders to design and implement future state processes, operating models and technology and data enablement solutions.
  • Develops and maintains a broad knowledge and awareness of industry forces, competition, and trends to assess viability of internal operating models. Monitors financial, legal, and other regulatory environments to ensure strategies are aligned with the overall company strategy, program vision, and regional market conditions. Develops thorough understanding of Vanguard functional areas with specific focus on teams impacted by the program. Keeps abreast of current issues in business operations and incorporates changing business needs into project solutions.
  • Partners with the Program Leadership Team and Change & Communications teams to ensure highly effective communications regarding business readiness and change management. Communicates regularly to key stakeholders in a variety of forums (leadership events, governance meetings, town halls, etc.). Socializes recommendations and/or requests for information/support to an appropriately broad audience throughout Vanguard.
  • Proactively identifies, manages, and mitigates risks and any related project issues. Performs root cause analysis, identifies potential solutions, (including the cost/benefit of each option), communicates solutions on key issues or projects to management and business clients to obtain their input and buy-in as appropriate.
  • Participates in development of periodic business plans and budgets. Manages financial performance against fiscal plan and forecast for their workstream/projects.
  • Assists Program Management in managing in-flight projects. (e.g. Status reporting, overall project plan, issues, risks and dependencies logs, Steering Committee preparation, monitoring of budgets). Prepares for and leads key project meetings with internal clients across all stakeholders. Chairs and documents workshops and meetings.
  • Develops and manages vendor relationships that are required to meet workstream/project needs.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate should possess:

  • Undergraduate degree in business discipline or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.
  • Minimum of eight years progressively responsible management experience, including at least three to five years of experience in a senior leadership role. Exposure to multi-disciplinary global programs is preferred.
  • Self-starter with the ability to drive change, generate creative approaches/solutions and the desire to shape a "best in class" global organization.
  • Demonstrated commitment to enhancing knowledge of global financial services industry, unfamiliar business operations and technology. Assertively seeks out information through internal and external business partners and industry network.
  • Proven track record in creating win-win scenarios by building relationships, persuading and influencing, gaining buy-in from stakeholders with diverse objectives and perspectives.
  • Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with Senior Staff, Divisional Senior Leadership, Sub-divisional senior leadership as well as various levels of staff and management across the organization.
  • Excellent leadership skills and ability to think strategically.
  • Ability to motivate others and foster teamwork.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills/presentation skills.
  • Excellent judgment and ability to analyze and resolve issues.
  • Ability to function in a fast paced, somewhat ambiguous environment, balancing numerous activities simultaneously.

The role will be responsible for providing expert level IT Service Management leadership to define, design, implement, monitor and improve IT Infrastructure and Hosting Services at Vanguard. The selected candidate will design the service offerings, lead the service portal/catalog implementation and manage ongoing improvement of services (Network, Storage, Access, Distributed Hosting, Platform, Region) using the ServiceNow platform. The role will also be responsible for building and maintaining effective customer relationships with internal stake holders and request fulfillment teams.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Develops and cultivates effective relationship with business areas by keeping them informed about services and status of any upcoming service enhancements/retirements, understanding their business needs and acting as an as escalation point for service or customer satisfaction related issues.

Creates a roadmap for continuous refinement of implemented services based on customer feedback. Monitors service levels against agreed upon SLAs, conducts periodic Service Performance Management activities for assigned list of services and influences Product Teams/ external Service providers to address service level breaches.

  • Ensures product teams are appropriately planning for on-hand capacity to meet forecasted demands.

  • Participates in CAB, Incident Management, Problem Management and other ITIL process related meetings as necessary and represent one or services.
  • Defines operational and executive reporting and communication requirements as necessary to support Service Management and Governance.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.  Degree in computer science or computer engineering and/or a Master's degree preferred.
  • Minimum eight years of experience in specific technical specialty (Hardware, Operating Systems, Software Development, Telecommunications and Emerging Technologies). Broad IT experience preferred.
  • Exceptional conceptual, analysis, and problem solving skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentation and influencing/negotiation skills.
  • Broad knowledge of the financial services industry preferred.
  • Strong understanding of Agile Software Development, Systems analysis and design techniques, Quality assurance methodology and Inspections, Technical standards and deliverables, Production acceptance (including elevations), data modeling, and related advanced development standards.

Vanguard, one of the world's largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks Tax Analyst to provide tax planning, research and compliance services to Vanguard’s investment entities and their investors.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

Duties and Responsibilities

I. Prepares IRS Forms 1120-RIC, 8613, international tax filings, and tax provisions for Vanguard mutual funds.  Obtains or provides peer review when applicable.

II. Evaluates simple mergers, acquisitions, spin offs and other corporate transactions to determine US tax impacts.   Partners with other FFS departments to ensure optimal tax accounting and reporting.

III. Prepares all book-tax difference computations:  straddles, PFIC, derivatives, partnership accounting, FTC reporting, convertible securities, Section 382/CLCF, CFC reporting, RIC qualification, and shareholder reporting support.  Prepares uncertain tax positions work papers under ASC 740.   Assists with response to external auditors for financial reporting under GAAP.

IV. Keeps abreast of legislative and regulatory tax developments in the mutual fund industry domestically and internationally.  Identifies and suggests changes, implements tax planning opportunities in compliance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and tax law.

V. Maintains documented procedures.  Consistently evaluates procedures for process improvements.

VI. Responds to various requests for tax analysis of investments and shareholder impacts.

VII. Establishes and maintains excellent working relationships with internal groups.

VIII. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

• Undergraduate degree in Accounting or Finance, or equivalent combination of training and experience.  Progress towards an accounting qualification preferred.

• At least two years general experience including one year directly related accounting or tax experience.

• Previous knowledge of mutual fund industry preferred.

• Proficiency with Microsoft Office.

• Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.

To improve and add value to Personal Advisor Service offering by providing complex wealth planning consultations and support to Personal Advisor Services clients and financial advisors.

  • Provides financial and income tax planning consultations to a wide spectrum of Personal Advisor Service (PAS) clients and prospects. Develops an understanding of the client's financial situation and future needs through analysis of their current financial condition.  Works with the clients' other advisors to coordinate and ensure consistent delivery of financial planning services. Topics for consultation would include, but are not limited to: General Principles of Finance and Financial Planning, Insurance, Employee Benefits, Investments, Income tax, Estate, and Retirement planning.
  • Understands and analyzes client’s circumstances and objectives, reviews client’s estate wealth planning documents (estate planning, income tax, and other related documents) and makes appropriate recommendations. Educates client with respect to wealth planning matters.
  •  Assists in developing financial planning methodology and market positioning for PAS advisors and offer.
  • Articulates technical concepts in an understandable way.  Documents and provides subsequent communications to Personal Advisor Service clients and internal business partners.
  • Serves as a departmental subject matter expert on income tax and financial planning.  Supports internal financial advisors on their client's financial planning needs and provides guidance on the most complex issues.  Provides proactive subject matter expertise to department through training, distribution of relevant articles and literature, and various other forums. Contributes to external positioning regarding financial planning matters on vanguard.com, blog articles, new articles, etc.
  • Maintains an in-depth understanding of compliance, regulatory and departmental policies and procedures. Maintains in-depth understanding of the competitive landscape and market trends.
  • Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in finance-related discipline.  Masters in Taxation or Juris Doctorate or CPA strongly preferred.
  • Minimum of eight years of progressive financial planning and income tax planning experience, including working with ultra high net worth clientele.
  • CFP(R) strongly preferred.
  • Proven ability to practice discretion in confidential matters.
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate with clients and other crew members at all levels.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Broad knowledge of Vanguard funds in addition to the mutual fund industry in general preferred.
  • Excellent writing, speaking and client relationship skills.
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications – Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

The Retail Investor Group (RIG) serves the needs of Vanguard's retail clients—including high net worth, advisor clients, and small businesses – by researching questions, offering solutions, executing transactions, consulting, analyzing data, and providing advice and guidance. Because retail client needs are so varied, our division has diverse career opportunities in areas such as client relationship, processing, data reporting and analysis, advice, legal and compliance, and so much more. No matter what role they serve, all of our crew focus on keeping costs low, promoting growth, and improving client loyalty. If you are seeking an opportunity to broaden your industry knowledge and want to give clients the best chance for investment success, RIG could be the next step in your career. Vanguard is currently seeking a Director of Tax Compliance to lead a team of tax analysts and professionals and ensure compliance with domestic and foreign tax information reporting and tax withholding regulations, as well as, oversee tax-related client account updates ensuring accurate withholding and reporting. The Tax Compliance Director will employ a pro-active approach to information reporting and tax withholding to contribute to improved client reporting and business processes minimizing risk associated with regulatory penalties and/or non-compliance.

Primary duties and responsibilities:

  • Manages and develops staff by providing guidance, training, and motivation necessary to develop staff.  Hires, terminates, evaluates, and counsels personnel.  Sets performance standards, reviews performance, provides regular and ongoing feedback
  • Oversees and maintains accountability for the regulatory compliance and tax documentation procedures for the RIG Division's broker dealer and transfer agent retail investor tax, cost-basis and withholding reporting and filing.  Ensures that returns are filed accurately and timely and all financial refunds and liabilities are reconciled and properly accounted.
  • Interprets and communicates evolving US, and state tax rules and regulations.  Ability to review detailed tax information and client documentation to offer tax compliance guidance to business operations
  • Work with operational and business colleagues to ensure processes and controls are in place to ensure proper tax documentation is on file and withholding and reporting occurs in accordance with IRS Regulations.
  • Oversees multiple end-to-end business processes to ensure compliance with SEC and FINRA regulations.  Provides second-level interpretation of SEC and FINRA rules and regulations.  This includes all aspects of change management, legal and compliance issues, service, operations interfaces with legacy systems, workflow and procedures, testing requirements, reporting budget, and benefits measurement. Leads and manages Retail Tax Compliance and Oversight functions for the division. Implements appropriate measures and reporting to control activities and/or functions that support the transfer agency and/or broker dealer.
  • Reviews all applicable current and future regulatory requirements in order to ensure effective Written Supervisory Procedures (WSP) are in place.  Enhances procedures commensurate with changes in market regulation.  Utilizes the necessary FINRA securities licenses, acts as the Registered Principal Responsible for several WSP to ensure they are updated and followed.  Ensures proper identification and training of delegates.
  • Protects and enhances Vanguard's reputation through continued efforts to strengthen and improve tax reporting and services to clients.  Partners with various Vanguard departments to analyze and resolve potential compliance or complaint issues, in a timely and thorough manner.  Proactively monitors the regulatory landscape, and assesses impact to service offers, internal workflows and procedures.  Ensures readiness for regulatory inspections and examinations.
  • Directs and motivates Tax Analyst team ensuring they are meeting overall business plan objectives and other desired results.  Promotes cohesiveness and cooperation within RIG Operations and other business partners; follows up on implementation of policies to ensure that they are consistently applied.
  • Demonstrates initiative and creativity in developing strategy plans and goals for Retail Tax Compliance;  Assesses internal and external client needs as a basis for recommending service enhancements while addressing the regulatory and operational related risks Seeks ways to control costs while minimizing reputation, regulatory, legal, and monetary risk to RIG and Vanguard overall.
  • Participates in all aspects of annual business planning and long-term strategic direction for the department and Vanguard.  Understands the financial dynamics of the business forecast and proactively manages business segment expenses appropriately.
  • Maintains an appropriate level of Vanguard, Financial Industry and Tax Compliance knowledge; keeps current on Vanguard policies and objectives, continues to expand knowledge of the business and industry, keeps current on competition.  Participates on industry committees involving tax policy.

Headquartered in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, Vanguard is one of the world’s largest investment management companies with approximately $3.3 trillion in assets under management. Vanguard provides an extensive set of investment products and services to individual investors, institutions, employer-sponsored retirement plans, and financial professionals. Vanguard is known for competitive investment performance, a broad array of funds, top client service, and costs that are among the industry’s lowest.

Most investment firms are either publicly traded or privately owned. Vanguard is different: It is owned by the Vanguard funds, which are in turn owned by their clients. Helping Vanguard investors achieve their goals is the firm’s sole reason for existence. With no other parties to answer to and therefore no conflicting loyalties, Vanguard makes every decision—including the decision to keep investing costs as low as possible—with only its clients’ needs in mind.

Vanguard is recognized frequently as an employer of choice and for its comprehensive total rewards package of compensation, benefits, and work–life programs. The Company has more than 14,500 employees (referred to as “crew members” in keeping with Vanguard’s nautical theme) in Valley Forge, Pennsylvania; Charlotte, North Carolina; and Scottsdale, Arizona as well as Australia, the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, Canada and five other countries. Its investment philosophy of long-term focus and diversification extends to its employees as well. Vanguard is highly selective in hiring at the outset, and then invests significantly in each crew member’s development, focusing on cultivating his or her managerial and strategic capabilities. The result is a collaborative environment where measurable goals are set and delivered upon by teams of highly committed professionals.

Department Overview
Vanguard’s Organizational Consulting Services (OCS) group is a team of consultants helping senior executives (Managing Directors and their direct reports) consider and respond to the most pressing issues impacting Vanguard’s growth and success. In response to both market and internal challenges, OCS helps drive change initiatives to enact the corporate vision, improve business activities, drive efficiency and establish new business segments.

The Transformation Consultant engages with Vanguard executives to help them consider how to address these issues. These interactions generally result in a variety of OCS-led initiatives including business or department redesign, enterprise-wide transformation, and major project support. The Transformation Consultant will lead or serve as a key member of the teams that deliver these projects.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

  • Work with clients to assess the best-fit organization or operating model to ensure the business is positioned to execute its strategy and meet its stated goals
  • Conduct current state organizational assessments to isolate strengths, challenges and opportunities to improve organization in response to evolving business strategies or environments
  • Generate hypotheses to improve clients’ operating models, org structures and test hypotheses via a blend of qualitative analysis (e.g., client interviews) and quantitative analysis (e.g., spans and layers)
  • Develop data-driven recommendations for future-state organization designs and associated enablers (e.g., decision rights, critical behaviors)
  • Facilitate client group discussions on how to improve organizational effectiveness (e.g., ways of working, visioning sessions) and provide real-time consultation on potential solutions.
  • Provide short-term, focused consultations to business leaders on common organizational and change-related challenges.
  • Lead the specific elements (e.g., change management work stream, organizational analysis) of larger business transformation efforts and develop and deliver impactful, cohesive, and comprehensive recommendations.
  • Assist in the development of transformation structures, approaches and work plans.
  • Independently lead engagements of appropriate size, scope, and complexity.
  • Collaborate with OCS colleagues, HR partners, and stakeholders across Vanguard to develop effective and coordinated approaches to address business issues.
  • Tailor transformation, organization design, and change management solutions for specific client situations and challenges and develop associated deliverables.
  • Promote the development of OCS colleagues through project work and professional experiences.
  • Identify and support initiatives to further develop the OCS practice (e.g., contributions to OCS knowledge management and best practices).

Required Experience & Qualifications

Key Skills & Knowledge:

  • Ability to identify strategic priorities and direction in complex and ambiguous circumstances
  • Versatility to work across multiple subject matter domains and client groups
  • Excellent consultative, presentation, and facilitation skills
  • Superb problem solving skills; logical and analytical thinker
  • Strong executive presence
  • Proven teamwork capabilities; strong relationship management and interpersonal skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Attentive to details and deadlines; ability to manage multiple initiatives
  • Strong project management, planning and organizational skills
  • Ability to effectively work independently and identify when to engage others

Work Experience:

  • Experience in one or more of the following specialties: strategy consulting, management consulting, large-scale transformations, global operating models, organizational design, organizational effectiveness and change management
  • Experience working closely with senior leadership
  • Experience in client service and consultation
  • Experience working with a global organization preferred

Education/Certifications:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience
  • Advanced degree preferred

Recent OCS Projects:

IT Vision: Help CIO consider how best to deliver enterprise-wide IT service to Vanguard’s global footprint. Project includes visioning, designing organizational structure; delivering organizational change project to move toward new structure.

Globalization: Working with Vanguard’s senior-most leadership to develop and implement operating model guidelines for Vanguard’s growth outside the US. It has involved developing a system to clarify global vision, accountability, structure and leadership to ensure global organization evolves systematically moving forward.

Aligning Resources with Business Objectives: Assortment of design projects across business areas with various aims, including: aligning Vanguard resource strategy to our service offering in 401k business and designing and implementing division level shared services functions in the retail and institutional businesses.

Major Project Consultation: Efforts in IT, Finance, Security, Marketing, and other areas - serving as strategic change advisors on enterprise transformations that involve a combination of operating model redesigns, technology implementations, and merging or realigning functions.

Other: Increased involvement in broad organizational effectiveness questions, including developing an offer in the assessment and intervention to enhance organizational climate, culture and engagement.
 

Successful Candidates:

OCS consultants have a diverse mix of skills and experiences. Several current team members have been consultants with strategy firms (including BCG, Booz & Company and Deloitte), have deep expertise in advising senior level executives and experience in broader organizational effectiveness offerings. Most members of OCS have advanced degrees, including MBAs and PhDs.

To provide senior level telecommunications Voice services, including implementing, and maintaining voice system deliverables and work objects.

Duties and Responsibilities

1.  Provides senior level voice telecommunications services, including designing and implementing PBX, VRU, CTI and ACD deliverables. Coordinates vendor installations of new and existing technologies, including software, patches, upgrades, applications, in multiple sites/states.

2.  Maintains and monitors complex voice systems. Tests configuration changes in the staging area or in the modeling software. Monitors capacity to ensure that all services are avaialable at peak times of usage.

3.  Works closely with business division staff to identify voice work objects and conditions under which deliverables execute.

4.  Writes scripts, vectors, strategies etc. to execute voice deliverables.

5.  Provides senior level telecom voice services for complex issues elevated from the Support Center. Adds, updates, and closes records in the IT Problem Management and Change Management databases. Reviews related records to identify requests that may have an impact on systems. Troubleshoots and resolves complex issues.

6.  Presents at inspections, change management, and related meetings to identify issues.

7.  Writes documentation, including policies and procedures. Creates diagrams of various systems. Maintains and administers the telecom PBX documentation repository.

8.  Tests and evaluates IT vendor products.

9.  Works closely with telecommunications staff to define architecture.

10.  Researches and estimates capacity planning needs. Generates standard and ad hoc reports of trends.

11.  Identifies opportunities to improve system and application performance, including automating manual system tasks.

12.  Trains and mentors staff. Resolves complex issues elevated from staff.

13.  Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures.

14.  Participates in special projects and performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Five years' telecom PBX/voice, contact center or CTI/VRU experience.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills.
  • Strong analysis and problem solving skills.
  • Strong time management skills.
  • Strong internal business client focus.
  • Advanced knowledge of the following telecom PBX/voice practices and concepts: full product life cycle, technical standards and deliverables, telecom system installations, trunks and stations, telephone switches, CTI/VRU hardware and software, PBX/voice hardware and software, ACD software, network and related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DLC, and ASYNC).
  • Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products: HP Openview, Lotus Notes, Microsoft Office Suite, Visio.
  • Advanced knowledge of current versions of the following products, preferred: Microsoft Project.

Special Factors

Verint call recording experience is a plus

Experience with Genesys call center technology is a plus

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

Vanguard, one of the world’s largest investment management companies and a recognized employer of choice, seeks a Financial Advisor Associate to build ongoing relationships and provide portfolio management to a diverse array of clients and communicate our investment philosophy and recommendations in a clear and concise manner while working within a collaborative team environment.

  • Develops a thorough understanding of each client's financial situation in order to create and deliver a suitable strategy based upon Vanguard's investment philosophy. Provides investment strategies to achieve client's goals. Identifies the appropriate risk tolerance, discuss appropriate savings or spending strategies and provide additional financial planning solutions as needed. Provides both verbal and written plans to communicate the recommended strategies following department guidelines.
  • Conducts periodic reviews of portfolios and provide appropriate reports addressing client's ongoing advisory needs.
  • Demonstrates advanced Client Relationship Management (CRM) skills along with strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Participates in the business development process as needed with prospective clients to deepen relationships and conduct consultations during the enrollment process.
  • Initiates and implements the agreed upon investment strategy; complies with Vanguard methodology and investment guidelines; documents and maintains organized client files which meet department compliance standards.
  • Utilizes department tools and technology to provide the optimal client experience.

  • Focuses on professional development by maintaining an in-depth understanding of financial planning, capital markets, and the financial services industry. Stays abreast of significant changes or developments (e.g. taxation, regulatory, legal, competitive) within the financial services field. Maintains all required licenses and designations.

  • Continuously identifies process improvement opportunities along with innovative business solutions.
  • Participates in special projects and perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Series 7, 63, and 65 required.

  • Strong investment orientation and interest in providing asset management.
